alert.note: Alert for Athens; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 7:17PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Meigs, southwestern Washington, southeastern Athens, southwestern Pleasants, west central Ritchie, north central Wirt and Wood Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 717 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Washington, or near Coolville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Belpre, Coolville, Vienna, Washington, Mineralwells, Tuppers Plains, Lubeck, Boaz, North Hills, Walker, Petroleum, Little Hocking, Schultz, Waverly, Freeport, Blennerhassett, Davisville and Greencastle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 165 and 183. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
